titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Beard Papers MSS.263
titlestmt.author: Ashley Todd

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 21:23:10 -0500.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Les Dames d'Escoffier New York Archive (MSS.150)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); James Beard Papers; MSS 263; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into thirteen series:

Although the collection was partially processed when it arrived at Fales, there was little original order, and no order that could be definitively credited to James Beard. Therefore, some rearrangement was undertaken.

The collection is grouped into twelve series based on type of material. Each series is arranged alphabetically and then chronologically based on the information provided. All original folder titles and arrangements have been maintained. Descriptions are at the folder level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials relating to James Beard's professional career as a chef, food writer and cooking instructor, as well as some materials relating to his personal life. Materials include drafts of manuscripts and articles, galley proofs, scripts for television shows, correspondence, date books, itinerary, recipes, cooking lessons, photographs, printed material, clippings and media.

The collection is arranged into 12 series:
Series I: Manuscripts
Series II:Assorted Writing
Series III:Recurring Television Shows and Columns
Series IV: Correspondence
Series V:Personal
Series VI: Recipes
Series VII:Events
Series VIII: Printed Material
Series IX:Clippings
Series X:Miscellaneous
Series XI: Photographs
Series XII: Media

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Andrews Beard, world-renowned chef, was born in Portland, Oregon on May 5, 1903. He studied briefly at Reed College in Portland but left in 1923 to join a touring theatrical troupe and pursue a career as an actor and singer. In the mid-1930s he began to supplement his income with catering work, and in 1937 he settled in New York and opened a gourmet food shop, Hors D'Oeuvre, Inc. The work at the shop led to Beard's first book, Hors d'Oeuvres and Canapés, in 1940.

During the war years, Beard served with the U.S. Seamen's Service, establishing sailors' canteens in Rio de Janeiro, Puerto Rico, Panama and Marseille. When he returned to New York he resumed writing cookbooks, publishing prolifically and establishing himself as America's most noted culinary authority. In 1946 he was given his own segment on a pioneering television program, NBC's "I Love to Eat," becoming one of the first TV chefs.

Over the years, Beard contributed articles and columns to numerous magazines, including Gourmet, House and Garden and Woman's Day. In the 1970s he wrote a syndicated newspaper column, "Beard on Food."
In 1955 Beard established the James Beard Cooking School in New York, and for many years he served as a consultant to food producers and restaurateurs.

Beard published over twenty books in his lifetime, among them The Fireside Cookbook, The James Beard Cookbook, Delights and Prejudices, a Memoir with Recipes, and James Beard's Theory and Practice of Good Cooking.
James Beard died on January 21, 1985 at age 81.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was donated to NYU Libraries in 2008 by The American Heritage Center at the University of Wyoming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuscripts for many of Beard's numerous cookbooks. It is arrange into fifteen subseries based on project. The folders within each subseries are arranged alphabetically and then chronoligcally, if dated. The "Unidentified" subseries contains discrete records that appear to have been part of larger, unidentified projects. Criteria for this subseries included pagination and titles that suggest the draft process of writing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of all non-recurring, non-manuscript writing, including short, independent works, notes, and works by others with comments by Beard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of recurring, non-manuscript writing, including scripts from television shows and various magazine columns. Subseries are arranged alphabetically by project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains Beard's professional and personal correspondence. All materials in original folders were kept together with the original folder titles. Loose correspondence that did not appear to be in any particular order was arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: [Mailing Labels to The University of Wyoming]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains Beard's personal materials, including awards, calendars, certificates, datebooks, itineraries and receipts. Materials are arranged alphabetically within two subseries: General and Awards.

odd.p: Originally attached to a blank block of wood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains the considerable array of foldered and loose recipes found among Beard's Papers. Foldered records were kept in their original order and for loose recipes, original order was maintained as much as possible by leaving groups of similarly focused recipes together, marked by the sqaure brackets surrounding their folder title. Loose recipes that did not appear to be in any particular order were placed in folders titled [Misc. Recipes].

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials regarding professional events Beard took part in, including cooking classes, contests and demonstrations. The materials are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains printed materials kept by Beard, including booklets, catalogs, maps, newsletters and posters. It is divided into two subseries by genre and arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the Water Resource Bulletins for Pennsylvania from 1966-1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains clippings from various magaines and newspapers. Materials are arranged alphabetically by publication title, if provided, and then by article title.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains primarily newspaper clippings that were originally unarranged. Due to their considerable quantity, they have remained unarranged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains miscellaneous materials that do not fit within any other series, including writing by others about Beard, writing by others that is not annotated by Beard, lists and blank postcards. The materials are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs and negatives. The materials in this series are arranged chronologically with all undated photographs at the end.
